intro: Exocarpos capnodioides, commonly known as the African starfruit or wild starfruit, is a small shrub or tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its pinnate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, round, star-shaped berry that turns red when mature. The plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
